title.rendered: How to Reach Gujarat by Road, Air, and Railway

content.rendered:
Gujarat is among one of the top-rated travel and holiday destinations in India. This western coastal metropolitan city has developed into a modern marvel with being home to several of the iconic structures and legendary historical sites. From the step-wells to the statue of unity and from the holy places of worship to the adventurous Gir forest ranges and so much more, no wonder it has been attracting tourists from all over the world not only for trade but also for admiring the natural beauty it holds.

Reaching Gujarat is no longer a hassle. This place, due to its growing popularity among the masses, has become more connected than ever before. Through groundbreaking technological advances, various transportation options now connect Gujarat to the rest of India and the world through airways, roadways, waterways, and railways. Here is the detailed information on how you can successfully explore the hidden as well as the popular gems of Gujarat:

By Air:

It doesn’t matter if you are traveling domestic or international, Gujarat has it all covered. With the presence of around 17 airports so you can stop wondering about you can reach Gujarat by air. Sardar Vallabhbhai Airport which is located in Ahmedabad is the most popular one among the rest. This airport is very well connected with flights connecting places like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, and Kolkata among others.

Within Gujarat one can easily access places like Bhavnagar, Vadodara, Surat, Bhavnagar, etc. through daily or weekly available flights. Flight companies like indigo, jet airways, emirates, spice jet, etc. ply to and fro. The airport is developed matching world standards and is fit for travel. The terminal 1 here operates domestic flights whereas the terminal 2 is for domestic flights. One can easily get a cab service from here and reach their destination.

By Railway:

In case your budget to Gujarat does not allow you to travel via airway then, one can choose to reach Gujarat via a remarkable network of railway connection. All the major and minor cities of Gujarat are well connected with a range of railways running to and fro Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and even the city of Punjab. Surat, Ahmedabad, Rajkot, and Vadodara are some of the busiest of all the railway stations in Gujarat. Some other important railway stations here include the ones present in Porbandar, Gandhinagar, Rajkot, Ahmedabad, etc. the railway station of Vadodara falls en-route the Delhi-Mumbai track. The city of Ahmedabad is also well connected with major tourist destinations like Jaipur, Jodhpur, Jaisalmer, Udaipur, etc. via the railway lines. Getting cabs, autos or other such transportations is least of your worries as they are very easily present the moment you step outside of the station compound.

By Road:

Travelling in Gujarat by road is sure a treat for travelers, if you decide to go to Gujarat as a part of your road trip then you have nothing to worry about as the entire state is very well connected with a range of highways and roadways not only from within from various outside neighboring places as well. One can reach Gujarat at a very cheap ticket price from places like Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Maharashtra via the state-run bus services. One can even book online a Volvo for extra comfort. If traveling on road from Mumbai one can easily reach thereafter completing 16 hours of drive from Mumbai. You can even hire a cab service or rent a car through several tours and travel agencies in Gujarat. The roads are also safe to drive on.

Commute Within Gujarat:

Through Local Bus Services:

The public transportation available in Gujarat makes travelling even easier. From the durable and well-connected network of state-run buses to the private collection of buses, you can feel free to choose your mode of transportation with ease here. Not only from within but the state of Gujarat is also very nicely connected with roads through state and national highways to its neighboring places as well making mobility very easy for not just tourists but for local residents as well. These local buses connect Ahmedabad to Vadodara via a 4 hour of road journey and to Bhuj via 6 hours of journey.

Through Car/Cab Service:

If you decide on taking your own car or hiring a cab for the trip or if you wish to explore the Gujarati landscape in peace and at your own pace then this is the best way of going. It is a very good option as all along the roads and routes there are exits, food stalls, and stopover locations present where one can halt and relax for a bit before continuing on with the travel. For travelling within the city one can easily get a cab and go around or even take the cab outside to places like ran of Kutch, Bhuj, and Vadodara etc.

Through Local Trains:

Gujarat is very well connected internally with a range of railway lines and connects cities like Vadodara, Bhuj, and Ahmedabad among others. Almost 8 to 10 train services ply in between Ahmedabad and Bhuj which are located at a distance of 8 hours from each other. This is another way of cost-cutting in your travel plans for Gujarat and will also save you money since the train tickets are not very pricey as compared to the cab services.

So all you have to do is pick the model that suits you best and fits your budget requirement without any hassle for a tension-free journey.
